author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
## PR Summary

For users familiar with using SSH typically the syntax for the target is `user@host`.  This PR
enables use of `-HostName` or `-SSHConnection` parameters to embed the username
and/or port as part of the hostname such as:

> new-pssession -h steve@mycomputer:22
> invoke-command -sshconnection @{hostname="steve@mycomputer"}

Removed use of validation method that explicitly disallowed anything more than just the host name.
Added method to create a uri from the hostname and parse out the username and port if specified.

Tests waiting on https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/3904

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6284
